titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Its Records, 1860-1966, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Abel Ramirez

profiledesc.creation: Text converted and initial EAD tagging provided by Apex Data Services, October 2000.

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Ellwood Estates Records, 1860-1966
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The collection contains the business records of the Ellwood Estates and the Ellwood family who provided lands for people to establish farms and small ranches in the South Plains.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Ellwood Estates was formed in 1910 after the death of Isaac L. Ellwood (1833-1910). Ellwood, co-inventor and manufacturer of barbed wire, purchased the Spade Ranch (located in Lubbock, Hale, Hockley, and Lamb counties, Texas) in 1891, and the Renderbrook Ranch (located in Mitchell County, Texas) in 1889. The Ellwood Estates were formed from these ranch properties and were administered by Ellwood's two sons, William L. (1859-1933) and Erwin P. (1874-?), and A. W. Fisk. Beginning in 1924, the Ellwoods sold portions of the Spade Ranch for farming and colonization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, financial and legal material, photographs, printed material, and scrapbook material concerning the business operations of Ellwood Estates and the Ellwood family. It bulks (1878-1966) with financial material relating to Ellwood's ranching operations during his life time and the sale of farm properties after his death.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ellwood Estates Records, 1860-1966, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Hopping, R. C. (Richard Coke). The Ellwoods: Barbed Wire and Ranches. Lubbock: Texas Technological College, 1962.
Kelton, Steve. Renderbrook: a Century Under the Spade Brand. Fort Worth: Texas Christian University Press, 1989.
Ludeman, Mayme Carol. The Land Phase of the Colonization of the Spade Ranch. Thesis (M.A.)--Texas Technological College, 1939.
